revised_title: Remote Sounding of Atmospheric Temperature from Satellites: Introduction
tldr: This article introduces the concept of remotely measuring atmospheric temperature from satellites using carbon dioxide emission in the infrared spectrum. The authors discuss the principles of designing suitable instrumentation for such observations and describe the development of infrared techniques to extend remote temperature measurements to higher altitudes and design a simple, robust radiometer for remote sounding of the lower atmosphere.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
